thinkers.name: Michael Levin
thinkers.context: Primary author exploring developmental bioelectricity as a cognitive mechanism underlying morphogenesis and behavioral cognition across biological scales.

thinkers.name: Paul Lyon
thinkers.context: Contributor to basal cognition field studying cognitive capacities of single cells and their physiological competencies.

thinkers.name: Fred Keijzer
thinkers.context: Researcher working on morphological computation and the evolution of electrically excitable networks.

thinkers.name: Alan Turing
thinkers.context: Historical figure who recognized deep symmetries between morphogenesis and behavioral cognition as early as 1952.

thinkers.name: William James
thinkers.context: Proposed cybernetic definition of intelligence as ability to reach same goal by different means, foundational to problem-space approaches.

thinkers.name: Giovanni Pezzulo
thinkers.context: Contributor to understanding morphogenetic-behavioral isomorphisms and computational principles of collective intelligence.

thinkers.name: Alexis Pietak
thinkers.context: Creator of scientific visualizations including planarian regeneration imagery for research communication.

thinkers.name: Douglas Blackiston
thinkers.context: Researcher on novel organismal forms and plasticity in metamorphosis and ectopic organ development.

thinkers.name: Erin Switzer
thinkers.context: Collaborator on morphospace navigation research in tadpole metamorphosis.

thinkers.name: Calvo
thinkers.context: Researcher extending cognition concepts to diverse biological systems including plants and microbes.

thinkers.name: Karl Friston
thinkers.context: Developer of free-energy framework applied to pattern formation and cognitive regulation in biological systems.

thinkers.name: Chris Fields
thinkers.context: Contributor to frameworks linking minimal physicalism to cognition and consciousness across scales.

thinkers.name: Francis Baluska
thinkers.context: Researcher on plant cognition and cellular consciousness as basis for life's cognitive properties.

thinkers.name: Robert Rosen
thinkers.context: Foundational theorist cited for understanding organization and complexity in biological systems.

concepts.name: Developmental Bioelectricity
concepts.context: Ancient mechanism using ion channels and gap junctions to enable collective computation and coordinate behavior in morphogenesis, predating neural systems.

concepts.name: Basal Cognition
concepts.context: Emerging field studying proto-cognitive capacities and evolutionary origins of cognition in simple organisms and cells lacking brains.

concepts.name: Collective Intelligence
concepts.context: Emergent property arising when competent subunits coordinate via bioelectric networks to generate coherent agents with goals and memories belonging to the whole.

concepts.name: Cognitive Scaling
concepts.context: Process by which simple homeostatic competencies of individual cells scale up through network coordination to generate large-scale behavioral intelligences.

concepts.name: Membrane Potential (Vmem)
concepts.context: Bioelectric state determined by ion channel activity that encodes memories, goals, and behavioral capacities in both neural and non-neural tissues.

concepts.name: Gap Junctions
concepts.context: Direct connections between cells enabling propagation of bioelectric states and small molecules, critical for scaling up computation across tissues.

concepts.name: Morphogenesis
concepts.context: Process of body formation exhibiting intelligent problem-solving and navigation of morphospace to achieve species-typical anatomical outcomes.

concepts.name: Anatomical Morphospace
concepts.context: High-dimensional parameter space of possible body configurations through which developing systems navigate toward goal states during embryogenesis and regeneration.

concepts.name: Pattern Memory
concepts.context: Bioelectric representation of target anatomical state that guides regeneration and development, stable yet rewritable through physiological experience.

concepts.name: Homeostatic Setpoint
concepts.context: Set-point value maintained by homeostatic loops that defines the anatomical or physiological goal toward which a system regulates itself.

concepts.name: Regulative Development
concepts.context: Developmental process in which tissues flexibly adjust outcomes to reach correct morphology despite perturbations or unusual starting conditions.

concepts.name: Regeneration
concepts.context: Process of regrowing lost body parts guided by bioelectric pattern memory, exhibiting learning and adaptation through physiological experience.

concepts.name: Cancer Suppression
concepts.context: Mechanisms of maintaining cellular cooperation and preventing metastasis through bioelectric coordination and anatomical homeostasis.

concepts.name: Evolutionary Pivot
concepts.context: Evolutionary mechanism repurposing ancient bioelectric algorithms and cellular machinery from morphogenetic control into behavioral control systems.

concepts.name: Ion Channels
concepts.context: Molecular components setting membrane potential by controlling ion segregation; voltage-gated conductances acting as biological transistors with memory properties.

concepts.name: Neurotransmitter
concepts.context: Signaling molecules propagating electromotive forces between cells, enabling communication in both neural and developmental bioelectric systems.

concepts.name: Planarian Regeneration
concepts.context: Free-living flatworms exhibiting remarkable regenerative capacity with behavioral memories apparently imprinted onto new brain tissue during regeneration.

concepts.name: Xenopus Tadpole
concepts.context: Model organism exhibiting radical plasticity in sensory system reconfiguration and morphospace navigation during metamorphosis.

concepts.name: Ectopic Organ
concepts.context: Organ or tissue induced to form in anatomically inappropriate location through bioelectric state manipulation, demonstrating plasticity of morphogenetic control.

concepts.name: Metamorphosis
concepts.context: Developmental transformation requiring extensive neural and anatomical restructuring while maintaining behavioral and informational continuity.

concepts.name: Plasticity
concepts.context: Capacity of biological systems to modify outcomes or adapt to novel circumstances through experience without genetic change.

concepts.name: Agency
concepts.context: Property of goal-directed behavior and problem-solving capacity; capability to reach goals through flexible means in diverse environments.

concepts.name: Problem Space
concepts.context: Formal space of possible states and transitions relevant to an agent's behavior; context-dependent framework for analyzing competencies.

concepts.name: Self
concepts.context: Emergent entity with unified goals, memories, and behavioral repertoires that arise from coordination of cellular collectives.

concepts.name: Consciousness
concepts.context: First-person experiential phenomena; explicitly set aside in this work in favor of third-person observable behavioral and cognitive capacities.

concepts.name: Intelligence
concepts.context: Degree of ability to reach same goal by different means; capacity for adaptive problem-solving in diverse circumstances.

concepts.name: Homeostatic Loops
concepts.context: Self-regulating systems maintaining stable setpoints through feedback mechanisms; fundamental units enabling emergent goal-directed behavior.

concepts.name: Competency
concepts.context: Degree of problem-solving ability and adaptive capacity within a particular problem space or domain.

concepts.name: Multiscale Competency Architecture
concepts.context: Hierarchical biological organization where each level solves problems in its own problem space while contributing to higher-level functions.

concepts.name: Emergence
concepts.context: Property arising from collective activity of components that cannot be predicted from components alone; minds emerging from collectives of cells.

concepts.name: Integrated Information
concepts.context: Cross-level information processing enabled by bioelectric networks allowing physiological states to encode meaning and behavior.

concepts.name: Credit Assignment Problem
concepts.context: Challenge of assigning causal responsibility for outcomes to appropriate agents; solved by tissue networks in behavioral and morphogenetic systems.

concepts.name: Associative Memory
concepts.context: Learned connection between distinct experiences or stimuli that emerges at collective level despite no single cell experiencing both events.

concepts.name: Teleonomy
concepts.context: In cybernetic sense, property of systems pursuing defined goal states; apparent purposefulness arising from feedback mechanisms.

concepts.name: Cognitive Light Cone
concepts.context: Spatio-temporal scale of goals and awareness accessible to an agent; expands from single-cell to organism-level scales during development.

concepts.name: Bioelectrical Signaling
concepts.context: Use of membrane potential gradients to transmit information and coordinate cellular activities in morphogenesis and behavior.

concepts.name: Morphological Computation
concepts.context: Computational processes inherent in body structure and morphology; blurs distinctions between mind and body in robotics and biology.

concepts.name: Neural Decoding
concepts.context: Neuroscience research program committed to reading mental content from electrophysiological states; applicable to developmental bioelectricity.

concepts.name: Supervenience
concepts.context: Philosophical relation where mental/informational properties arise from and depend upon physical substrate properties.

concepts.name: Computational Boundary Of Self
concepts.context: Scope of functional integration defining which components constitute a unified agent; changes during development and evolution.

concepts.name: Diverse Intelligence
concepts.context: Intelligent behavior in unfamiliar substrates and problem spaces; requires recognizing competencies beyond conventional neural-behavioral domains.

concepts.name: Individuality
concepts.context: Quality of being a bounded, unified entity with coherent identity and agency; emerges from cellular collectives during development.

concepts.name: Agential Material
concepts.context: Matter exhibiting goal-directed behavior and problem-solving; cells retain autonomous competencies within larger collectives.

concepts.name: Developmental Memory
concepts.context: Information about target body patterns stored in bioelectric states and other mechanisms, enabling regeneration and regulative development.

concepts.name: Trophic Memory
concepts.context: Long-term memory of positional damage or trauma encoded in tissue, guiding regeneration toward same aberrant pattern years later.

concepts.name: Counterfactual Thinking
concepts.context: Ability to represent possible futures or alternative states; present primitively in bioelectric systems encoding multiple morphogenetic possibilities.

concepts.name: Meta-Stability
concepts.context: Property of systems with multiple stable attractor states that can flip stochastically; seen in perceptual bistability and cryptic worm states.

concepts.name: Downward Causation
concepts.context: Causal influence of higher-level organizational properties on lower-level components; enables whole-organism goals to guide cellular behavior.

concepts.name: Xenobots
concepts.context: Proto-organisms assembled from frog embryo cells exhibiting spontaneous autonomous behavior and novel self-replication mechanisms.

concepts.name: Active Inference
concepts.context: Computational framework where agents minimize prediction error by actively sampling or altering environment; applies to morphogenesis.

concepts.name: Perceptual Bistability
concepts.context: Phenomenon where systems oscillate between two interpretations or stable states; occurs in both perception and morphogenetic circuits.

concepts.name: Coarse-Graining
concepts.context: Simplification of complex dynamics by averaging over details; traditional lens limiting discovery of morphogenetic control mechanisms.

concepts.name: Continuity Hypothesis
concepts.context: Framework assuming continuity of mechanisms across natural evolved forms, synthetic life, and potential alien biology.

concepts.name: Hybrid Intelligences
concepts.context: Intelligences combining biological and artificial components; increasingly relevant as understanding of diverse cognition expands.

concepts.name: Reprogrammability
concepts.context: Capacity of systems to alter goals and behaviors through physiological experience without genetic modification; feature of biological control systems.

concepts.name: Modular Control Architecture
concepts.context: Hierarchical organization enabling specification of high-level goals while automatically activating necessary downstream modules.

concepts.name: Integration
concepts.context: Coordination across multiple scales of biological organization enabling coherent function from molecular to organism level.

concepts.name: Gene Regulatory Networks
concepts.context: Networks of genetic and molecular components controlling gene expression; can exhibit learning and Pavlovian conditioning as collectives.

concepts.name: Dukkha
concepts.context: Buddhist concept referenced in context of molecular traces of experience erased through gap junction sharing in cell networks.

concepts.name: Baldwin Effect
concepts.context: Evolutionary mechanism where learned behaviors become genetically assimilated; may apply to bioelectrically-induced phenotypes.

concepts.name: Chimeras
concepts.context: Organisms composed of cells from different sources; examples of remarkable interoperability and plasticity of biological systems.

concepts.name: Cyborg
concepts.context: Hybrid biological-technological systems; emerging category requiring expanded frameworks for understanding diverse intelligence.

concepts.name: Hybrots
concepts.context: Hybrid robotic organisms combining biological and engineered components; future category of diverse agents for behavioral study.

concepts.name: Active Information
concepts.context: Information actively shaping matter; physical basis of how meaning emerges from bioelectric substrate in biological systems.

concepts.name: Particle Plasticity
concepts.context: Plasticity at the scale of cellular components; relates to epigenetic controls enabling adaptation to varied circumstances.

concepts.name: Affordances
concepts.context: Action possibilities available to cells encoded in their hardware properties; shaped by evolution into control capacities.

concepts.name: Dissociative Identity Disorder
concepts.context: Psychological condition mentioned as conceptual analog to fragmented cognitive control; minimal usage in text.

concepts.name: Scale-Free Cognition
concepts.context: Cognitive and proto-cognitive capacities that operate across multiple biological scales, from molecular to organismal levels.

concepts.name: Competency Architecture
concepts.context: Framework proposing that biological systems exhibit hierarchical behavioral and proto-cognitive capabilities at multiple organizational levels.

concepts.name: Embodiment
concepts.context: Principle that cognition arises from and depends upon physical body structure and interaction with environment.

concepts.name: Free-Energy Approach To Pattern Regulation
concepts.context: Application of free-energy principle to understanding how biological systems maintain stable patterns through minimizing surprise.

concepts.name: Morphological Coordination
concepts.context: Common ancestral function unifying neural and non-neural signaling systems in coordinating body structure and form.

concepts.name: Synthetic Morphology
concepts.context: Bioengineering approach using agential materials to design and create novel living morphologies beyond natural evolution.

concepts.name: Individuation
concepts.context: Process by which developmental bioelectricity enables cells to coordinate as unified individuals with coherent body boundaries and identity.

concepts.name: Anatomical Homeostasis
concepts.context: Maintenance of stable body structure and identity despite perturbations; homeostatic target specified by bioelectric patterns.

concepts.name: Shape Homeostasis
concepts.context: Active regulation of organism shape and size toward species-typical morphology despite developmental variations.

concepts.name: Markov Blankets
concepts.context: Information-theoretic concept used in active inference and free-energy frameworks to define boundaries of cognitive systems.

concepts.name: Minimal Physicalism
concepts.context: Philosophical framework proposing consciousness and cognition can emerge from minimal physical substrates across scales.

concepts.name: Competency In Navigating Arbitrary Spaces
concepts.context: Proposed invariant for measuring and comparing cognition across diverse embodiments and biological systems.

concepts.name: Technological Approach To Mind Everywhere
concepts.context: Framework for understanding diverse minds and bodies through experimental interventions and engineering rather than observation alone.

concepts.name: Bioelectric Code
concepts.context: Ancient computational medium using bioelectric gradients to dynamically control growth and form across evolutionary time.

concepts.name: Morphogenesis As Bayesian Inference
concepts.context: Framework treating pattern formation as process of inference where biological systems minimize prediction error.

concepts.name: Left-Right Asymmetry
concepts.context: Developmental asymmetries controlled by serotonergic and bioelectric signaling in early embryonic stages.

concepts.name: Craniofacial Development
concepts.context: Formation of head and facial structures guided by bioelectric gradients and developmental signals.

concepts.name: Xenopus Development
concepts.context: African clawed frog used as model organism for studying developmental bioelectricity and pattern formation.

concepts.name: Confabulation
concepts.context: Creation of false memories through optogenetic manipulation; demonstrates malleability of memory engrams.

concepts.name: Engrams
concepts.context: Physical substrates of memory in neural tissue; subject to optogenetic manipulation and artificial implantation.

concepts.name: Artificial Life
concepts.context: Computational and engineering field studying properties of life through simulation and creation of artificial living systems.

concepts.name: Epigenetic Inheritance
concepts.context: Non-genetic transmission of traits through chemical modifications and cellular mechanisms; adds Lamarckian dimension to evolution.

concepts.name: Developmental Plasticity
concepts.context: Capacity of developing organisms to generate different phenotypes from same genotype based on environmental inputs.

concepts.name: Modularity
concepts.context: Organization of biological systems into semi-autonomous functional units that can evolve and be recombined.

concepts.name: Heterarchy
concepts.context: Organizational structure with multiple levels of control and decision-making without fixed hierarchy.

concepts.name: Self-replication
concepts.context: Property of reconfigurable organisms to create copies of themselves through coordinated motion.

concepts.name: Self-modeling
concepts.context: Process by which systems maintain internal representations of themselves enabling adaptation and resilience.

concepts.name: Cancer
concepts.context: Pathological state representing loss of anatomical homeostasis; addressable through bioelectric interventions.

concepts.name: Regenerative Medicine
concepts.context: Field applying understanding of regeneration and bioelectricity to therapeutic tissue repair and organ replacement.

concepts.name: Supervised Learning
concepts.context: Machine learning approach where system learns from labeled examples; demonstrated in mechanical and biological networks.

concepts.name: Memes
concepts.context: Units of cultural information analogous to genes; influence attitudes, behaviors, and survival-relevant traits.

concepts.name: Major Transitions In Evolution
concepts.context: Key evolutionary shifts such as transition from unicellular to multicellular life; involve changes in information integration.

concepts.name: Bayesian Mechanics
concepts.context: Physics-based framework treating systems as embodied beliefs and deriving mechanical principles from Bayesian inference.

concepts.name: Computational Psychiatry
concepts.context: Field applying computational models to mental illness; uses frameworks like active inference and free-energy principle.

concepts.name: V-Atpase
concepts.context: Molecular pump creating voltage potentials across membranes; regulates bioelectric gradients controlling development.

frameworks.name: Basal Cognition
frameworks.creator: Michael Levin, Fermin Baluška
frameworks.context: Research program understanding evolutionary and embryological origins of behavioral capacities through study of simple minds in diverse biological systems.

frameworks.name: Problem Space Framework
frameworks.creator: William James, Michael Levin
frameworks.context: Formalizes analysis of goal-directed behavior by defining space of possible states an agent navigates toward goal states.

frameworks.name: Multiscale Competency Architecture
frameworks.creator: Michael Levin
frameworks.context: Systematic framework depicting nested levels of biological organization where each level solves problems in its own problem space.

frameworks.name: Evolutionary Pivot Model
frameworks.creator: Michael Levin, Jake Fields
frameworks.context: Framework explaining how ancient bioelectric mechanisms were repurposed across different problem spaces during evolution.

frameworks.name: Morphospace Navigation Model
frameworks.creator: Giovanni Pezzulo, Michael Levin
frameworks.context: Formalizes anatomical control and development as navigation through high-dimensional morphological parameter spaces toward goal states.

frameworks.name: Neural Decoding Program
frameworks.context: Neuroscience research program attempting to read mental content from electrophysiological states; applicable beyond neural systems.

frameworks.name: Marr's Taxonomy
frameworks.creator: David Marr
frameworks.context: Hierarchical analysis framework from three levels: computational theory, algorithm, and implementation; applied to bioelectric control.

frameworks.name: Active Inference Framework
frameworks.creator: Giovanni Pezzulo
frameworks.context: Computational model of agents minimizing prediction error through active sampling; applicable to morphogenetic systems.

frameworks.name: Computational Boundary Framework
frameworks.creator: Michael Levin
frameworks.context: Framework defining functional integration boundaries determining which components constitute a unified agent or self.

frameworks.name: Von Neumann Replication Model
frameworks.context: Self-replication mechanism; referenced for novel kinematic self-replication discovered in xenobots.

frameworks.name: Continuity Hypothesis Framework
frameworks.creator: Michael Levin
frameworks.context: Overarching framework using biophysical and evolutionary approaches to identify invariants across natural, hybrid, and synthetic life forms.

frameworks.name: Competency Architecture
frameworks.creator: Michael Levin, Giovanni Pezzulo, and collaborators
frameworks.context: Multi-scale framework describing hierarchical behavioral and proto-cognitive capabilities at different organizational levels.

frameworks.name: Free-Energy Principle
frameworks.creator: Karl Friston
frameworks.context: Unified framework for understanding biological organization through minimization of prediction error across scales.

frameworks.name: Active Inference
frameworks.creator: Karl Friston, Giovanni Pezzulo
frameworks.context: Theory explaining how organisms minimize surprise by updating beliefs and acting on environment simultaneously.

frameworks.name: Developmental Bioelectricity Framework
frameworks.creator: Michael Levin
frameworks.context: Systematic approach to understanding how bioelectric gradients regulate pattern formation and morphogenesis.

frameworks.name: Morphogenesis As Bayesian Inference
frameworks.creator: Michael Levin, Giovanni Pezzulo, Karl Friston
frameworks.context: Framework treating biological pattern formation as inference process where systems minimize prediction error.

frameworks.name: Minimal Physicalism
frameworks.creator: Chris Fields, Michael Levin
frameworks.context: Philosophical framework proposing consciousness and cognition emerge from minimal physical substrates at any scale.

frameworks.name: Technological Approach To Mind Everywhere (TAME)
frameworks.creator: Michael Levin
frameworks.context: Experimentally-grounded framework for understanding diverse embodiments and minds through engineering interventions.

frameworks.name: Diverse Intelligence Research
frameworks.creator: Michael Levin and collaborators
frameworks.context: Emerging interdisciplinary field examining cognitive capacities across diverse biological systems and scales.

frameworks.name: Basal Cognition Framework
frameworks.creator: Paul Lyon, Francis Baluska
frameworks.context: Theoretical framework addressing proto-cognitive capabilities in non-neural organisms and cellular systems.

frameworks.name: CBC-Clock Theory of Life
frameworks.creator: Francis Baluska, Alfred Reber
frameworks.context: Theory integrating cellular circadian clocks and cellular consciousness as basis for cognitive properties of life.

institutions.name: Allen Discovery Center
institutions.context: Research center at Tufts University led by Michael Levin studying developmental bioelectricity and basal cognition.

institutions.name: Tufts University
institutions.context: Institution hosting the Allen Discovery Center and research on developmental bioelectricity and regenerative medicine.

institutions.name: Harvard University
institutions.context: Institution hosting the Wyss Institute for Biologically Inspired Engineering where Michael Levin conducts research.

institutions.name: Wyss Institute for Biologically Inspired Engineering
institutions.context: Research institute at Harvard University engaged in biologically-inspired engineering and regenerative medicine research.

institutions.name: Levin Lab
institutions.context: Research group led by Michael Levin focused on developmental bioelectricity, regeneration, and synthetic living systems.

institutions.name: John Templeton Foundation
institutions.context: Funding organization supporting research on consciousness, cognition, and philosophical questions about life and mind (Grant 62212).

institutions.name: Astonishing Labs
institutions.context: Organization providing funding and support for research on bioelectricity and synthetic biology.

institutions.name: Morphoceuticals
institutions.context: Company founded by Michael Levin applying bioelectrical signaling research to regenerative medicine.

questions.question: How do large numbers of competent cellular subunits work together to generate coherent cognitive beings with goals, preferences, and memories that belong to the whole?
questions.context: Central question of basal cognition addressing emergence of unified minds from cellular collectives.

questions.question: What is the mechanism that enables cross-level integrated information processing from human thoughts to physiological states of individual cells?
questions.context: Fundamental question about how mental and physical levels of organization are coordinated.

questions.question: How can the same cellular collective with identical genome produce radically different anatomical outcomes based purely on bioelectric state?
questions.context: Questions the determinism of genetic specification and suggests importance of physiological information.

questions.question: How do morphogenetic systems make large-scale anatomical decisions through distributed cellular communication without centralized control?
questions.context: Addresses mechanisms of collective decision-making and emergence of unified behavior from decentralized components.

questions.question: Can principles of neuroscience be successfully generalized to non-neural biological systems and synthetic life?
questions.context: Questions validity of extending cognitive concepts beyond traditional neural systems.

questions.question: What constitutes the computational boundary defining which agents are unified selves versus swarms of independent agents?
questions.context: Questions individuality and identity in context of nested biological hierarchies.

questions.question: How can physiological experience rewrite anatomical memories encoded in bioelectric states without genetic modification?
questions.context: Addresses mechanisms of epigenetic memory and top-down control of morphogenesis.

questions.question: Can bioelectric circuit states represent counterfactual possibilities encoding multiple potential futures simultaneously?
questions.context: Questions nature of representation and information in physiological systems.

questions.question: What invariant principles enable cognitive and problem-solving capacities to scale across diverse biological substrates?
questions.context: Seeks deep unification of cognition principles applicable to natural, artificial, and hybrid intelligences.

questions.question: How do systems maintain coherent identity and goal-directedness despite radical transformation during metamorphosis?
questions.context: Questions continuity of self through extreme developmental changes.

questions.question: What is the nature and origin of cognitive selves in biological systems?
questions.context: Central question motivating research into proto-cognition across diverse scales; implications for understanding consciousness and agency.

questions.question: How do bioelectric gradients and membrane potentials instruct and regulate body pattern formation?
questions.context: Fundamental question about mechanisms linking electrical signaling to developmental morphogenesis independent of genetic sequences.

questions.question: Can cognition and learning occur without neural tissue?
questions.context: Challenges traditional neurocentric views of cognition; suggests proto-cognitive capacities in unicellular and non-neural organisms.

questions.question: How does developmental bioelectricity enable multicellular coordination and individuation?
questions.context: Questions how individual agents emerge from collective cellular activity through shared bioelectric fields.

questions.question: What principles govern the emergence of diverse forms of intelligence and embodied minds?
questions.context: Motivates research into cognitive similarities and differences across evolutionary lineages and artificial systems.

questions.question: How can bioelectrical interventions be used to reprogram morphology and achieve synthetic biology goals?
questions.context: Raises questions about designing novel life forms and ethical implications of manipulating developmental fate.

questions.question: Is consciousness distributed across biological scales rather than localized to brains?
questions.context: Challenges localist theories; suggests consciousness may be property of integrated information systems at any scale.

questions.question: How do biological systems maintain anatomical homeostasis and recover from injuries?
questions.context: Central to understanding regeneration and application to therapeutic repair of damaged tissues.
